section: cstr.h inc/cstr/cstr.h Go to the documentation of this file.00001 // cstr.h 00002 00003 #pragma once 00004 00005 #include "CSTRpredefines.h" 00006 00007 #ifdef __CSTR_OK 00008 # undef __CSTR_OK 00009 #endif // defined(__CSTR_OK) 00010 00011 #if __STDC_VERSION__ >= CSTR_DEFAULT_C_STD 00012 00013 #ifdef CSTR_sys_strdup 00014 # undef CSTR_sys_strdup 00015 #endif 00016 00017 #if defined(CSTR_OS_WIN32) 00018 # include <string.h> 00019 # define CSTR_sys_strdup _strdup 00020 #else 00021 # ifdef _POSIX_C_SOURCE 00022 # undef _POSIX_C_SOURCE 00023 # endif 00024 # define _POSIX_C_SOURCE 200809L 00025 # include <string.h> 00026 # define CSTR_sys_strdup strdup 00027 #endif // defined(CSTR_OS_WIN32) 00028 00029 #include <stdbool.h> 00030 #include <stdlib.h> 00031 00032 #define CSTR_NPOS -1 00033 #define CSTR_SUCCESS 0 00034 #define CSTR_FAIL 1 00035 #define CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 2 00036 00037 // NOTE: Dear developer, check all the available macros here 00038 #ifdef CSTR_RECOMMENDED 00039 # define CSTR_DYNAMIC_CAPACITY 00040 # define CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN 00041 # define CSTR_ENABLE_GET_CONST_RETURN 00042 #endif // CSTR_RECOMMENDED 00043 00044 // NOTE: 00045 // Other macros that are not recommended but available for flexibility are: 00046 // CSTR_DEFINE_INTERNAL : Define the internal files inside of the header file (cstr.h) 00047 // Check the definitions below the definition of the CSTR struct 00048 // CSTR_RECOMMENDED : Enable recommended macros, such as CSTR_DYNAMIC_CAPACITY, CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN, ... 00049 00050 /** 00051 * @brief Custom dynamic string type 00052 * 00053 * The fields should typically be managed only through the cstr_* API 00054 * Directly modifying them can lead to undefined behavior unless explicitly intended 00055 */ 00056 typedef struct 00057 { 00058 /** 00059 * @brief Tracks whether this CSTR has been initialized 00060 * @note Should only be set by internal or initialization functions 00061 */ 00062 bool initialized; 00063 00064 /** 00065 * @brief Pointer to the character buffer 00066 * Always NULL terminated if properly managed through the API 00067 */ 00068 char *data; 00069 00070 /** 00071 * @brief If true, capacity is fixed and operations that exceed 00072 * it return an error instead of reallocating the size 00073 */ 00074 bool forceCap; 00075 00076 /** 00077 * @brief Current string length (not counting the NULL terminator) 00078 */ 00079 size_t len; 00080 00081 /** 00082 * @brief Total allocated capacity (including NULL terminator) 00083 */ 00084 size_t cap; 00085 } CSTR; 00086 00087 #ifdef CSTR_DEFINE_INTERNAL 00088 /** 00089 * @brief Update the capacity automatically 00090 * IMPORTANT: 00091 * This function won't do anything if macro `CSTR_DYNAMIC_CAPACITY` is NOT defined 00092 * 00093 * @return Return if fail or success 00094 * @note Typically used in the other defined functions for CSTR inner API 00095 */ 00096 int __cstr_updateCap(CSTR *_str); 00097 00098 /** 00099 * @brief Internal helper to format and set the string content. 00100 * 00101 * Uses a printf-style format string and variadic arguments to 00102 * overwrite the content of a CSTR. The function computes the 00103 * required buffer size, reallocates if needed (unless forceCap 00104 * is active), formats the string, and updates length/capacity. 00105 * 00106 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify. 00107 * @param _fmt printf-style format string. 00108 * @param ... Variadic arguments corresponding to the format. 00109 * 00110 * @return 00111 * - CSTR_SUCCESS on success 00112 * - CSTR_FAIL if parameters are invalid, allocation fails, 00113 * or vsnprintf reports an error 00114 * - CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT if forceCap is enabled and the 00115 * required size exceeds current capacity 00116 * 00117 * @note Typically used in the other defined functions for CSTR inner API 00118 */ 00119 static int __cstr_setFormat(CSTR *_str, const char *_fmt, ...); 00120 #endif // defined(CSTR_DEFINE_INTERNAL) 00121 00122 /** 00123 * @brief Initialize a new empty CSTR 00124 * 00125 * @return A new CSTR instance. Check `.initialized` or if CSTR is not NULL to confirm success 00126 */ 00127 CSTR cstr_init(void); 00128 00129 /** 00130 * @brief Initialize a CSTR with a copy of an original C-string 00131 * 00132 * @param _dest Pointer to the destination CSTR 00133 * @param _src NULL terminated string to copy from 00134 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS on success, otherwise CSTR_FAIL 00135 */ 00136 int cstr_initCopy(CSTR *_dest, const char *_src); 00137 00138 /** 00139 * @brief Destroy and clean up a CSTR and its allocated objects 00140 * 00141 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to destroy 00142 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS on success, otherwise CSTR_FAIL 00143 */ 00144 int cstr_destroy(CSTR *_str); 00145 00146 /** 00147 * @brief Set the content of a CSTR to a new C-string in `.data` 00148 * 00149 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00150 * @param _data Null terminated string to set 00151 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS, CSTR_FAIL, or CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 00152 */ 00153 int cstr_set(CSTR *_str, const char *_data); 00154 00155 /** 00156 * @brief Append a suffix to the end of a CSTR 00157 * 00158 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00159 * @param _suffix NULL terminated string to append 00160 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS, CSTR_FAIL, or CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 00161 */ 00162 int cstr_add(CSTR *_str, const char *_suffix); 00163 00164 /** 00165 * @brief Extract a substring in place from a CSTR 00166 * 00167 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00168 * @param _start Starting index of the substring 00169 * @param _len Length of the substring 00170 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00171 */ 00172 int cstr_substr(CSTR *_str, size_t _start, size_t _len); 00173 00174 /** 00175 * @brief Clear a CSTR to an empty string without freeing memory 00176 * 00177 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to clear 00178 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00179 */ 00180 int cstr_clear(CSTR *_str); 00181 00182 /** 00183 * @brief Convert all characters in a CSTR to uppercase 00184 * 00185 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00186 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00187 */ 00188 int cstr_upper(CSTR *_str); 00189 00190 /** 00191 * @brief Convert all characters in a CSTR to lowercase 00192 * 00193 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00194 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00195 */ 00196 int cstr_lower(CSTR *_str); 00197 00198 /** 00199 * @brief Insert a string at a specific position in a CSTR 00200 * 00201 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00202 * @param _data NULL terminated string to insert 00203 * @param _pos Position at which to insert, 0-based 00204 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS, CSTR_FAIL, or CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 00205 */ 00206 int cstr_insert(CSTR *_str, const char *_data, size_t _pos); 00207 00208 /** 00209 * @brief Reverse the content of a CSTR in place 00210 * 00211 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00212 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00213 */ 00214 int cstr_reverse(CSTR *_str); 00215 00216 /** 00217 * @brief Clear the content of a CSTR and optionally shrink capacity 00218 * 00219 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to shrink 00220 * @param _len New length (characters to keep) 00221 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00222 */ 00223 int cstr_shrink(CSTR *_str, const size_t _len); 00224 00225 /** 00226 * @brief Create a numeric string from an integer 00227 */ 00228 int cstr_fromInt(CSTR *_str, int _val); 00229 00230 /** 00231 * @brief Create a numeric string from a long 00232 */ 00233 int cstr_fromLong(CSTR *_str, long _val); 00234 00235 /** 00236 * @brief Create a numeric string from a float 00237 */ 00238 int cstr_fromFloat(CSTR *_str, float _val); 00239 00240 /** 00241 * @brief Create a numeric string from a double 00242 */ 00243 int cstr_fromDouble(CSTR *_str, double _val); 00244 00245 /** 00246 * @brief Create a hexadecimal string from an unsigned integer 00247 */ 00248 int cstr_fromHex(CSTR *_str, unsigned int _val); 00249 00250 /** 00251 * @brief Replace only the first occurrence of a substring 00252 * 00253 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR 00254 * @param _old Substring to locate 00255 * @param _new Replacement string 00256 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or an error code (CSTR_FAIL, ...) 00257 */ 00258 int cstr_replace(CSTR *_str, const char *_old, const char *_new); 00259 00260 /** 00261 * @brief Replace all occurrences of a substring 00262 * 00263 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR 00264 * @param _old Substring to locate 00265 * @param _new Replacement string 00266 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00267 */ 00268 int cstr_replaceAll(CSTR *_str, const char *_old, const char *_new); 00269 00270 /** 00271 * @brief Erase a portion of the string 00272 * 00273 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR 00274 * @param _pos Starting position 00275 * @param _len Number of characters to remove 00276 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00277 */ 00278 int cstr_erase(CSTR *_str, int _pos, size_t _len); 00279 00280 /** 00281 * @brief Find the first occurrence of a substring 00282 * 00283 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to search 00284 * @param _find Substring to locate 00285 * @return Index of first match, or CSTR_NPOS if not found 00286 */ 00287 size_t cstr_find(const CSTR *_str, const char *_find); 00288 00289 /** 00290 * @brief Find a substring starting from a specific index 00291 * 00292 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to search 00293 * @param _find Substring to locate 00294 * @param pos Starting index 00295 * @return Index of match, or CSTR_NPOS if not found 00296 */ 00297 size_t cstr_findFrom(const CSTR *_str, const char *_find, size_t pos); 00298 00299 /** 00300 * @brief Count occurrences of a single character within a CSTR 00301 * 00302 * Iterates through the string and counts how many times the specified 00303 * character appears in the `.data` buffer. 00304 * 00305 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to inspect 00306 * @param ch Character to count 00307 * 00308 * @return Number of occurrences of `ch` in the string 00309 * Returns 0 if `_str` is NULL or not initialized 00310 * 00311 * @note This function performs a linear scan across all characters. 00312 */ 00313 size_t cstr_countChar(const CSTR *_str, const char ch); 00314 00315 /** 00316 * @brief Count occurrences of a substring within a CSTR 00317 * 00318 * Searches for non-overlapping occurrences of a null-terminated substring 00319 * inside the CSTRâ€™s `.data` buffer using strstr. Each found instance advances 00320 * the scan position by the length of the substring, preventing overlapping matches. 00321 * 00322 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to inspect 00323 * @param ch Null-terminated substring to count 00324 * 00325 * @return Number of non-overlapping occurrences found 00326 * Returns 0 if parameters are invalid (`_str`, `.data`, `ch`, or `*ch`) 00327 */ 00328 size_t cstr_count(const CSTR *_str, const char *ch); 00329 00330 /** 00331 * @brief Check if a CSTR begins with the given prefix 00332 * 00333 * @param _str The CSTR to check by value 00334 * @param _prefix The prefix string 00335 * @return true if it starts with prefix, else return false 00336 */ 00337 bool cstr_startsWith(CSTR _str, const char *_prefix); 00338 00339 /** 00340 * @brief Check if a CSTR ends with the given suffix 00341 * 00342 * @param _str The CSTR to check (by value) 00343 * @param _suffix The suffix string 00344 * @return true if it ends with suffix, false otherwise 00345 */ 00346 bool cstr_endsWith(const CSTR _str, const char *_suffix); 00347 00348 /** 00349 * @brief Compare two CSTR instances for equality 00350 * 00351 * @param _s1 First CSTR (by value) 00352 * @param _s2 Second CSTR (by value) 00353 * @return true if equal, false otherwise 00354 */ 00355 bool cstr_comp(const CSTR _s1, const CSTR _s2); 00356 00357 /** 00358 * @brief Return "true" or "false" based on a boolean value 00359 * 00360 * @param _bool Boolean value 00361 * @return "true" if _bool is true, otherwise "false". 00362 */ 00363 const char *cstr_bool(const bool _bool); 00364 00365 /** 00366 * @brief Get if the string is empty 00367 * Return true if: 00368 * `.len` smaller or equal to 0 00369 * `.data` is empty ("") 00370 * `.initialized` is false 00371 * `_str` is NULL 00372 * If none of the requirements are met, means that it's not empty, hence, return false 00373 * 00374 * @return Is the string empty? Yes (true), No (false) 00375 */ 00376 bool cstr_empty(const CSTR *_str); 00377 00378 #define __CSTR_OK 00379 00380 #ifdef __CSTR_OK 00381 # ifdef CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN 00382 # define CSTR_GET_RETURN(_cstr, _call, ...) ((_call(&_cstr, __VA_ARGS__)), _cstr) 00383 # else 00384 # define CSTR_GET_RETURN(_cstr, _call, ...) 00385 # endif // defined(CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN) 00386 00387 # ifdef CSTR_CONST_RETURN_USE_PTR_METHOD 00388 # define CSTR_CONST_RETURN_PTR_METHOD -> 00389 # else 00390 # define CSTR_CONST_RETURN_PTR_METHOD . 00391 # endif 00392 00393 # ifdef CSTR_ENABLE_GET_CONST_RETURN 00394 # define CSTR_GET_CONST_RETURN(_str, _call, ...) \ 00395 ({ \ 00396 CSTR tmpS; \ 00397 cstr_initCopy(&tmpS, _str CSTR_CONST_RETURN_PTR_METHOD data); \ 00398 _call(&tmpS, __VA_ARGS__); \ 00399 tmpS; \ 00400 }) 00401 # else 00402 # define CSTR_GET_CONST_RETURN(_str, _call, ...) 00403 # endif // defined(CSTR_ENABLE_GET_CONST_RETURN) 00404 #endif // __CSTR_OK 00405 00406 #else 00407 # error "Must use C11 as the minimum standard" 00408 #endif // __STDC_VERSION__ 00409
